mappingRows.quote: The workflow has way too many steps. I count 7 clicks minimum to get a differentiated assignment published.
The dropdown menus on the Assign to Groups screen don't clearly show which level goes to which group.
Spent 25 minutes trying to set up 3 ability levels for one assessment. This should take 5 minutes max.

recentHighSeverity.title: Navigation requires too many clicks
recentHighSeverity.description: Getting lost in the navigation between Configure Levels and Assign to Groups. Too many clicks to go back and forth.

recentHighSeverity.title: Minutes turn into hours
recentHighSeverity.description: Setting up one week of differentiated assignments takes me 2+ hours. This needs to be 30 minutes max.

recentHighSeverity.title: Multi-step process is a dealbreaker
recentHighSeverity.description: If configuring differentiation continues to require this many steps I'll go back to paper worksheets.

critical.summary: The differentiated assignment workflow loses 89% of users across 7 steps, with the worst drop-offs at 'Open Differentiation' (46%) and 'Assign to Groups' (46%). Teacher complaints align: 'Too many clicks' and 'Confusing UI' dominate feedback.
quotes: The workflow has way too many steps. I count 7 clicks minimum to get a differentiated assignment published.
After configuring levels I couldn't figure out how to actually assign them to my student groups. UI not intuitive.
Spent 25 minutes trying to set up 3 ability levels for one assessment. This should take 5 minutes max.
The dropdown menus on the Assign to Groups screen don't clearly show which level goes to which group.
